meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fragmented.
meanings.sent1: The fragmentariness of the puzzle made it challenging to put together.
meanings.sent2: The artist intentionally created a sense of fragmentariness in her abstract painting.
meanings.sent3: The fragmentariness of the jigsaw puzzle caused much frustration but also excitement.
meanings.sent4: The fragmentariness of the shattered mirror reflected the brokenness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentariness of the glass sculpture captured the beauty of imperfection.

meanings.definition: The condition of being in fragments or broken pieces.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully documented the fragmentariness of the ancient pottery they unearthed.
meanings.sent2: After the accident, the fragmentariness of the glass scattered across the road was a hazard.
meanings.sent3: The toddler found joy in the fragmentariness of the broken toy, seeing it as a new puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: The fragmentariness of the old building symbolized the passage of time and neglect.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentariness of the mosaic added a unique charm to the courtyard.
